qoutes.quote: Time and space are modes by which we think and not conditions in which we live.
qoutes.name: Albert Einstein

qoutes.quote: He who thinks great thoughts, often makes great errors.
qoutes.name: Martin Heidegger

qoutes.quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason but of imagination.
qoutes.name: Immanuel Kant

qoutes.quote: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
qoutes.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

qoutes.quote: Authenticity is a collection of choices that we have to make every day. It’s about the Choice to show up and be real. The choice to be honest. The choice to let out true selves Be seen.
qoutes.name: Brene Brown

qoutes.quote: As I began to love myself. I found that anguish and emotional suffering are only warning Signs that I was living my own truth. Today I know this is authenticity.
qoutes.name: Charlie Chaplin

qoutes.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
qoutes.name: Socrates

qoutes.quote: Only one man ever understood me, and he didn’t understand me.
qoutes.name: G. W. F. Hegel

qoutes.quote: Is man merely a mistake of God's? Or God merely a mistake of man's?
qoutes.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

qoutes.quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
qoutes.name: Epicurus

qoutes.quote: Freedom's just another word for nothing left to lose, Nothing, it ain't nothing honey, if it aint free.
qoutes.name: 'Me and Bobby McGee' by Kris Kristofferson

qoutes.quote: If people only knew how hard I work to gain my mastery. It wouldn't seem so wonderful at all.
qoutes.name: Michelangelo

qoutes.quote: Inspiration is for amateurs. The rest of us just show up and get the work done. If you wait around for the clouds to part and a bolt of lightning to strike you in the brain, you're not going to make an awful lot of work.
qoutes.name: Chuck Close

qoutes.quote: As I work at my drawings, day after day, what seemed unattainable before is now gradually becoming possible. Slowly, I'm learning to observe and measure. I don't stand quite so helpless before nature any longer.
qoutes.name: Vincent van Gogh

qoutes.quote: Every artist was first an amateur.
qoutes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

qoutes.quote: Life is sometimes hard. Things go wrong, in life and in love and in business and in friendship and in health and in all other ways that life can go wrong. And when things get tough, this is what you should do. Make good art.
qoutes.name: Neil Gaiman

qoutes.quote: When you talk, you are only repeating what you already know. But if you listen, you may learn something new.
qoutes.name: Dalai Lama

qoutes.quote: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal. Not to people or things.
qoutes.name: Albert Einstein

qoutes.quote: You are responsible for your happiness, if you expect others to make you happy, you will always be disappointed.
qoutes.name: A.P.J Kalam

qoutes.quote: Elegance is when the inside is as beautiful as the outside.
qoutes.name: Coco Chanel

qoutes.quote: Everyone is a moon and has dark side which he never shows to anybody.
qoutes.name: Mark Twain

qoutes.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
qoutes.name: Marie Curie

qoutes.quote: Common Sense is that which judges the things given to it by other senses
qoutes.name: Leonardo da Vinci

qoutes.quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
qoutes.name: Stephen Hawking

qoutes.quote: A wolf and a penguin could never live together, nor could a camel and a hippopotamus. That would be absurd.
qoutes.name: 'The Lobster' (2015)

qoutes.quote: The sun, with all the planets revolving around it, and depending on it, can still ripen a bunch of grapes as though it had nothing else in the universe to do.
qoutes.name: Galileo Galilei

qoutes.quote: Until man duplicates a blade of grass, nature can laugh at his so-called scientific knowledge.
qoutes.name: Thomas Edison

qoutes.quote: The highest forms of understanding we can achieve are laughter and human compassion.
qoutes.name: Richard Feynman

qoutes.quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.
qoutes.name: Stephen Hawking

qoutes.quote: One must be sane to think clearly, but one can think deeply and be quite insane.
qoutes.name: Nikola Tesla

qoutes.quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.
qoutes.name: Sir Isaac Newton

qoutes.quote: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I’m not sure about the universe.
qoutes.name: Albert Einstein

qoutes.quote: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
qoutes.name: Sir Isaac Newton

qoutes.quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.
qoutes.name: Niels Bohr

qoutes.quote: A scientist in his laboratory is not a mere technician: he is also a child confronting natural phenomena that impress him as though they were fairy tales.
qoutes.name: Marie Curie

qoutes.quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
qoutes.name: Anais Nin

qoutes.quote: Happiness comes from the full understanding of your own being.
qoutes.name: Marina Abramovic

qoutes.quote: Find something you really love doing and mix it with something you really care about. That’s why I’ve had such longevity as an artist. I really, really care about ending violence against women, and I really, really love playing music. It’s super enjoyable!
qoutes.name: Kathleen Hanna

qoutes.quote: Early in life I came to understand that I was the only person who could protect my own interests, and that, being alone, I must cultivate survivor skills and turn weaknesses into strengths.
qoutes.name: Jill Jolliffe

qoutes.quote: Use your faults, use your defects; then you’re going to be a star.
qoutes.name: Edith Piaf

qoutes.quote: Time heals, after all — although the clock that marks that kind of time has no hands.
qoutes.name: Suze Rotolo

qoutes.quote: I can control my passions and emotions if I can understand their nature.
qoutes.name: Spinoza

qoutes.quote: Long you live and high you'll fly, and smiles you'll give, tears you'll cry and all you touch and all you see is all your life will ever be.
qoutes.name: 'Breath' by Pink floyd

qoutes.quote: Up. And down. And in the end it's only round and round. and round.
qoutes.name: 'Us and them' by Pink floyd

qoutes.quote: Try not. Do or do not. There is no try.
qoutes.name: Yoda, 'Star Wars Episode V' (1980)

qoutes.quote: A wizard is never late, Frodo Baggins. Nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he means to.
qoutes.name: Gandalf, 'Lord of the rings' (2001)

qoutes.quote: You don't have to laugh at every poop joke, but if you've never laughed at one, there is something deeply wrong with you.
qoutes.name: George Carlin

qoutes.quote: Truth is like poetry. And most people fucking hate poetry.
qoutes.name: Overheard at a Washington D.C bar

qoutes.quote: It ain't what you don't know that gets you into trouble, it's what you know for sure that's just ain't so.
qoutes.name: Mark Twain

qoutes.quote: He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.
qoutes.name: Douglas Adams,'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy'
